verbs.description: uncross (third-person singular simple present uncrosses, present participle uncrossing, simple past and past participle uncrossed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To move something, especially one's arms or legs, from a crossed position.
(transitive) To undo the crossing or traversal of.
examples: “Don't call me stupid. I mean it. My parents don't ever call each other names. Name-calling and being nasty just breaks things and crosses lines you can't uncross.”
